column4: Can anyone help with ntsf-fix? Where is it located? Installed something that required restart while external hd and pen drive is inserted and restarted and now can't mount ntfs external hd. Something about using ntfs-fix error message came up
how do I open it? I think I already have it installed but can't locate it anywhere
it's run from the command line
what's the command I have to type? Ntfsfix?
it's ntfs-fix, but first you need to know what device is your ntfs partition and it needs to be unmounted
i.e. can you read files from it, see what's in it..
don't think so. That's what's written on the error. Can't mount
paste the whole error on pastebin
where is it, in a terminal?
should be able to select and ctrl+c copy it, or just select it and middle-click in a terminal... But this channel is for Ubuntu support
it would be best to try to boot into windows and disk check there first
if you want your user to be able to write to the whole drive, then do: sudo chown -R <user>:<user> /media/<mountpoint>
